channel.title: Best language to make a
channel.description: What is the best language to make a undetectable runescape bot? Delphi 7 SE, or C++.(Only ones I own besides VB6 which is virtually useless to me)

item.title: Best language to make a
item.dc:creator: @Avaphi Avaphi
item.description:
@Avaphi wrote:

If your bot doesnt interact with java, then there is no way it will be anything more then a color clicker, at least not anymore

Read full topic

item.title: Best language to make a
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:11, topic:47141”]Theres no ‘correct’ language to write an application in.In the end the output is still the same, and is only as good as you put in to it.Input means greater output.

Some program languages are designed to do things faster and cut the corners whilst other ones can do the exact same things but it gives the programmer/developer more options even though it is long.It basicaly gives the programmer power.[/quote]

Yeah, like Binary lol jk, that is very true, but there are some languages that actualy are smaller, and some that are compacted, so its kinda your choice.

Read full topic

item.title: Best language to make a
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Theres no ‘correct’ language to write an application in.In the end the output is still the same, and is only as good as you put in to it.Input means greater output.

Some program languages are designed to do things faster and cut the corners whilst other ones can do the exact same things but it gives the programmer/developer more options even though it is long.It basicaly gives the programmer power.

Read full topic

item.title: Best language to make a
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

[quote=“Sean, post:4, topic:47141”][quote author=wonderguy6 link=topic=65710.msg767040#msg767040 date=1168704803]

I don’t think the language really matters it is more the way it is coded that matters

That is true however, sometimes when its coded the languages gives it away by, lack of quality,
[/quote]

I dont see how a language could ever give anything away, only your code could make it detectable imo. Not to mention that dectatbility has more to do with how your app works and any potential oversights or poor implemenetation.[/quote]

Agreed, but to make it undetectable(unless you are making a rule breaker ) you need to learn the language very well.

Read full topic
